result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger Roy Thomas

records.addlTxt: 9:10 AM Defendant Roger Roy Thomas in court.  Attorney Jens Hubert Loberg in court for Roger Roy Thomas.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF106, 22TR631-632 heard at this time. ADA Schieffer: guilty/NC to 22CF106 with a 1 year DJOC, dismiss 22TR631-632. ADA Schieffer addresses reasons for agreement. Atty Loberg and Def agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights Defendant pleas guilty to 22CF106.3Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights.  Court finds Defendant guilty of 22CF106, dismisses 22TR631-632. ADA Schieffer and Atty Loberg address sentencing-joint recommendation for DJOC. Court withholds judgment of conviction in favor of the 1 year DJOC. Court approves the terms/conditions of the DJOC. Court: monies paid in 22TR631-632 to be refunded to Defendant. Defendant to remain until handed a signed copy of the DJOC 9:30
filed by Atty Jens Loberg. eif
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by ADA Joseph Schieffer. eif

Information will be filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Bond remains in its present form. Waive time limits. Court confirms address and phone number. 22TR631 and 22TR632 to follow. Court adjourned at 1:11 pm.

1:01 PM Roger Roy Thomas appears in Court,  Atty Jens Hubert Loberg, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF106 (PH), 22TR631 and 22TR632 (STC). ADA Schieffer states a waiver was filed. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Complaint read aloud. DA Hatch is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/ no conditions, no objection. Court so orders. Waive the time limits. Enter NG on 22TR631 and 22TR632 to follow. Court adjourned at 9:58 am.
